subject: Re: [junit] Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
msgSnippet: ... I think this maybe a design problem. The junit 4 is good. __________________________________________________
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>
> Mike Morris wrote:
>
>> ...or am I not understanding something?
>>
>> Tried @Ignoring an @BeforeClass method, but it doesn't get ignored.
>> Bug in the runner or in my understanding?
>
> I'm going to guess you can only @Ignore tests, and not @Before/@After
> methods. Kent, David, is that by design or just something you didn't
> consider?
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains ca <http://www.jbrains.ca>
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
>
>

I think this maybe a design problem. The junit 4 is good.
